definition: (of a turn of events) not too encouraging/far from good/anything but reassuring

sentences.english: At this point I felt things beginning to skid.
sentences.chinese: 这时，我感到事情有点不妙。

sentences.english: He sees things, active request to find cures textual.
sentences.chinese: 他看到情况不妙，主动要求找扁鹊来治病。

sentences.english: Matter turning worse advise what remedy .
sentences.chinese: 情况不妙，请电告补救方案。

sentences.english: Things are looking bluer than ever for us.
sentences.chinese: 情况对我们愈来愈不妙了。

sentences.english: A pretty low starting point and as far as Alana was concerned, one that could only get better – and it did.
sentences.chinese: 开局不妙，而且就阿拉娜而言，应该做得更好一点。

sentences.english: Kono with a bad look and and ran upstairs. Iron peak haze?
sentences.chinese: 河野满一看不妙拔腿就往楼上跑。

sentences.english: Fewer than three charities does not cut it.
sentences.chinese: 少于三个慈善性职位那可就不妙了。

sentences.english: The signs, sadly, are not good.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的是，目前迹象不妙。

sentences.english: When the boys realised what had happened, they fled the scene.
sentences.chinese: 当男孩们知道大事不妙时，纷纷逃离现场。

sentences.english: The sick child looks still worse today than yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 那个病童的情况今天看起来比昨天更不妙。

sentences.english: Clock from a see things start to go wrong, then.
sentences.chinese: 钟离一看情况不妙，于是冲了过去。

sentences.english: Ominously, Khatami also called for the execution of what he called "rioters' leaders".
sentences.chinese: 不妙的是，哈塔米还要求处死所谓的“暴徒领导人”。

sentences.english: I nosed out something wrong there.
sentences.chinese: 我当时感到有点情况不妙。

sentences.english: Fewer than three chari-ties does not cut it.
sentences.chinese: 少于三个公益性职位那可就不妙了。

sentences.english: By this time, officials in the Brussels control tower could tell that something was very wrong.
sentences.chinese: 这时候，布鲁塞尔控制塔的官员们知道大事不妙了。

sentences.english: The criminal had been captured, and now he had the threat of prison hanging over his head.
sentences.chinese: 罪犯被抓获，他感到不妙，这下可要蹲监狱了。

definition: to leave in stealth/to slip away
overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
everything bodes ill, no positive signs (idiom); inauspicious/everything points to disaster
hidden smile/smirk/to rejoice covertly/secret satisfaction concerning one's evil plans
suitable/to one's liking/to get along together
to be shocked/to be appalled/to be terrified
